# The `DataLayout` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

A parsed version of the target data layout string in and methods for querying it. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::DataLayout</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

A parsed version of the target data layout string in and methods for querying it.

The target data layout string is specified <em>by the target</em> - a frontend generating LLVM IR is required to generate the right target data for the target being codegen&#39;d to.

Definition at line 63 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/datalayout-h">DataLayout.h</a>.

### getTypeAllocSize() {#aa48b3b7e554b44f4e513d5dd8d9f9343}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>TypeSize llvm::DataLayout::getTypeAllocSize (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; Ty) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Returns the offset in bytes between successive objects of the specified type, including alignment padding.

If Ty is a scalable vector type, the scalable property will be set and the runtime size will be a positive integer multiple of the base size.

This is the amount that alloca reserves for this type. For example, returns 12 or 16 for x86&#95;fp80, depending on alignment.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/datalayout-h/#l00457">457</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/datalayout-h">DataLayout.h</a>.

### getTypeAllocSizeInBits() {#ad6df5869f0f8df9fd045efe5533e6280}

Returns the offset in bits between successive objects of the specified type, including alignment padding; always a multiple of 8.

If Ty is a scalable vector type, the scalable property will be set and the runtime size will be a positive integer multiple of the base size.

This is the amount that alloca reserves for this type. For example, returns 96 or 128 for x86&#95;fp80, depending on alignment.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/datalayout-h/#l00470">470</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/datalayout-h">DataLayout.h</a>.

### getTypeSizeInBits() {#acf0b1898efd7f81a078e9288befd9290}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>TypeSize llvm::DataLayout::getTypeSizeInBits (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; Ty) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Size examples:

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> SizeInBits StoreSizeInBits AllocSizeInBits&#91;&#42;&#93; <hr/>
 i1 1 8 8 i8 8 8 8 i19 19 24 32 i32 32 32 32 i100 100 104 128 i128 128 128 128 Float 32 32 32 Double 64 64 64 X86&#95;FP80 80 80 96

&#91;&#42;&#93; The alloc size depends on the alignment, and thus on the target. These values are for x86-32 linux. Returns the number of bits necessary to hold the specified type.

If Ty is a scalable vector type, the scalable property will be set and the runtime size will be a positive integer multiple of the base size.

For example, returns 36 for i36 and 80 for x86&#95;fp80. The type passed must have a size (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type/#a8ad67a33bae235fe3cca1c3e5a91ed2d">Type::isSized()</a> must return true).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/datalayout-h/#l00412">412</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/datalayout-h">DataLayout.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

  labels = {["inline"]}>
Returns the maximum number of bytes that may be overwritten by storing the specified type.

If Ty is a scalable vector type, the scalable property will be set and the runtime size will be a positive integer multiple of the base size.

For example, returns 5 for i36 and 10 for x86&#95;fp80.

### getTypeStoreSizeInBits() {#a3b229a84730d00c5e9ed36784521d304}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>TypeSize llvm::DataLayout::getTypeStoreSizeInBits (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; Ty) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Returns the maximum number of bits that may be overwritten by storing the specified type; always a multiple of 8.

If Ty is a scalable vector type, the scalable property will be set and the runtime size will be a positive integer multiple of the base size.

For example, returns 40 for i36 and 80 for x86&#95;fp80.

### isLegalInteger() {#a4865a13a415f04576388b969d04d1541}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::DataLayout::isLegalInteger (uint64&#95;t Width) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Returns true if the specified type is known to be a native integer type supported by the CPU.

For example, i64 is not native on most 32-bit CPUs and i37 is not native on any known one. This returns false if the integer width is not legal.

The width is specified in bits.
